de.unifrankfurt.informatik.dbis.dia.util

Class InstanceUtil<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unifrankfurt.informatik.dbis.dia.util.InstanceUtil<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the Class that is encapsulated by this class.

    public class InstanceUtil<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper-class for all reflecting uses of a class.

    Espacially Constructor-, getter- and setter-calls are handled by this class. One class can also handle more than one instance but only one Class.

    The class used within this util needs to implement a default c'tor.

    All getter and setter methods are stored within a HashMap while instatianting, aswell as the constructor. This means all Methods do not have to be loaded before calling and result to a more performant using of the reflecting method-calls.

    There can be either used objects via setInstance(Object) or new instances via createNewInstance(). New instances are created, too, if setValue(String, Object) or getValue(String) is called, and the instance is null.

    • Constructor Summary

      InstanceUtil(java.lang.Class<E> clazz)
      creates a InstanceUtil for the given Class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createNewInstance()
      creates a new instance of the handled class via the default c'tor.
      E getInstance()
      returns the currently used instance or a new one if instance is null.
      java.lang.Object getValue(java.lang.String field)
      retrieves the value of the given field via a suitable getter-method.
      void setInstance(E e)
      sets a new instance that should be used by now.
      void setValue(java.lang.String field, java.lang.Object value)
      sets the given value to the given field via a suitable setter-method.
